text: Any teacher, counselor, principal, coach, or other person of authority in a secondary level school who engages in sexual conduct with a student under the age of 20 years enrolled in that school or school system, or causes that student to engage in sexual conduct, shall be imprisoned for not more than 5 years, fined in an amount not to exceed $50,000, or both.

division.text: Criminal Law and Procedure and Prisoners.

heading.catch_text: Second degree sexual abuse of a secondary education student.
